thinking.disposable_income: Albany Park has a median household income of around $53,000, lower than Chicago's average. About 16% of residents live below poverty level, indicating limited disposable income for many households
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the moderate-to-low income levels, residents are price-sensitive to both transit fares and sales taxes. Many households need to carefully budget discretionary spending
thinking.accessibility: Well-served by CTA Brown Line, multiple bus routes, and major arterial roads. About 36% of residents use public transit for commuting, 45% drive, indicating balanced modal split. High transit dependency among lower-income residents
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritize lower transit fares and moderate sales tax to help lower-income transit users while maintaining service quality. 2. Support some driving fees to improve transit service without excessive burden on drivers. 3. Balance between travel time improvements and cost impacts. 4. Consider high transit usage rate in community. 5. Avoid highest tax/fee combinations due to limited disposable income. Selected policies that maintain affordable transit while gradually improving service through moderate fees
